intro: Castanea pumila subsp. ozarkensis, commonly known as the Ozark chestnut, is a shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, spiny fruits called nuts, which contain a single edible seed. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller size and more compact growth habit compared to the broader species.
